ccg-setinfo.name: What You Leave Behind
ccg-setinfo.game: Star Trek Collectible Card Game: Second Edition

card.name: Back to Basics
card.text: Your opponent counts each personnel and ship card in his or her discard pile and shuffles each of those cards into his or her deck. If fourteen or more cards were shuffled into his or her deck this way, all your personnel are stopped.

card.name: Caretaker's Wave
card.text: Unless you have Astrometrics and Engineer or 3 Navigation, stop all of your personnel and this dilemma is placed on your ship. Damage - At the start of each of your turns, the owner of this dilemma may place this ship at your mission.

card.name: Cargo Pirates
card.text: Randomly select a personnel to be stopped and if your opponent commands three Thief personnel, choose an additional personnel to be stopped.

card.name: Chula: The Chandra
card.text: Randomly select a personnel. Repeat this until you select a personnel with a cost equal to or greater than the first personnel that you selected. Stop each selected personnel.

card.name: Inferiority
card.text: Place this dilemma in your core. When your personnel begin a mission attempt, your opponent may remove this dilemma from the game to draw three extra dilemmas and spend three extra in total cost on dilemmas.

card.name: Juxtaposition
card.text: Your opponent may return up to two Persistent dilemmas he or she owns from beneath one of your completed missions to his or her dilemma pile and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

card.name: Moral Choice
card.text: Randomly select three personnel. If any of those personnel is a {fed} personnel, they are all stopped. Otherwise, choose one of those personnel to be stopped.

card.name: Neurogenic Field
card.text: Persistent. (When your personnel complete this mission, this dilemma's owner may discard a non-personnel card from hand to return this dilemma to his or her dilemma pile.) Choose a personnel who has Anthropology or Medical to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

card.name: Night Terrors
card.text: Persistent. (When your personnel complete this mission, this dilemma's owner may discard a non-personnel card from hand to return this dilemma to his or her dilemma pile.) Choose a personnel who has Medical or Science to be stopped. If you cannot, randomly select a personnel to be killed.

card.name: Old Differences
card.text: When you reveal this dilemma from the dilemma stack, if this mission is worth 35 or less points, it is cost -1. Randomly select two personnel to be stopped.

card.name: Prefix Codes
card.text: Place this dilemma on this mission. At the end of this mission attempt, if there are no damage markers on any of your ships at this mission, choose one of those ships and place this dilemma on it. Otherwise, overcome this dilemma. Damage - This ship is Shields -10.

card.name: Prisoner of the Exile
card.text: Persistent. (When your personnel complete this mission, this dilemma's owner may discard a non-personnel card from hand to return this dilemma to his or her dilemma pile.) Choose a personnel to be placed in your opponent's brig.

card.name: Shocking Betrayal
card.text: Choose a personnel to be stopped and your opponent may discard a non-{na} personnel from hand to choose a personnel that is the same affiliation as that discarded personnel to be killed.

card.name: Spatial Distortions
card.text: Persistent. (When your personnel complete this mission, this dilemma's owner may discard a non-personnel card from hand to return this dilemma to his or her dilemma pile.) Choose a personnel to be placed in your discard pile.

card.name: Stripped Down
card.text: Your opponent moves up to two dilemmas from beneath this mission to another of your non-headquarters missions.

card.name: Sylvia
card.text: For each event your opponent commands in his or her core, this dilemma is cost -1 (-2 for each Decay event). Unless you have 2 Leadership, Officer, Security, and Cunning>38 or 2 Engineer, Programming, and 2 Science, randomly select two personnel to be placed in your opponent's brig.

card.name: The Clown: Guillotine
card.text: Consume: 3. (Your opponent places the top two cards of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath this mission.) Your opponent names a skill. Randomly select a personnel with that skill. Unless that personnel has an attribute>6, randomly select a second personnel with that skill. Each selected personnel is killed and this dilemma returns to its owner's dilemma pile.

card.name: The Phage
card.text: Persistent. (When your personnel complete this mission, this dilemma's owner may discard a non-personnel card from hand to return this dilemma to his or her dilemma pile.) Choose a personnel to be placed in your discard pile.

card.name: Toe to Toe
card.text: Consume: 2. (Your opponent places the top card of his or her dilemma pile face up beneath this mission.) Randomly select a personnel. Unless you stop that personnel and another personnel with the same cost, he or she is killed.

card.name: Kir'Shara
card.text: Artifact. (To play this card, you must have completed a mission requiring Acquisition, Anthropology, or Archaeology.) When your Dissident present is stopped by a dilemma, you may make each player discard the top card of his or her deck.

card.name: Vascular Pad
card.text: When your personnel present is about to be stopped by a dilemma, you may place this equipment on the bottom of its owner's deck to prevent that.

card.name: A Few Minor Difficulties
card.text: Plays in your core. When you play this event, name a non-{Voy} ship. Each player ignores that ship's game text. When a player scores points, he or she may lose 5 points to destroy this event.

card.name: Are You Offering Me ... a Bribe?
card.text: To play this event, lose 5 points. Plays in your core. Your {fer} personnel may meet Integrity and Strength requirements of your missions and each dilemma you face at those missions using Cunning instead. Your {fer} personnel may attempt and complete your missions.

card.name: Clarity
card.text: Morph. To play this event, you must command two Founders. Plays in your core. When your Consume dilemma places any number of dilemmas beneath an opponent's mission, you may destroy this event to choose one of those dilemmas and return it to your dilemma pile.

card.name: Deja Q
card.text: Q. Plays in your core. When you reveal a Consume dilemma from your dilemma stack, you may take a Consume dilemma you own from beneath an opponent's completed mission and return it to your dilemma pile.

card.name: Distant Control
card.text: Decay: 3. To play this event, you must command three {rom} personnel. Plays in your core. When you play this event, name an event or interrupt. Opponents cannot play that named card. At the start of each of your turns, place the top card of your deck on this event.

card.name: Disruptive Presence
card.text: Discard a personnel from hand to download a personnel with the same affiliation as that discarded personnel, then discard a random card from hand. Destroy this event.

card.name: Five Year Mission
card.text: Decay: 5. (When there are five cards on this event, destroy it.) Plays in your core. When you are about to play a {TOS} card, you may place a {TOS} card from hand on this event to make that card cost -1. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Gatherers' Raid
card.text: Crime. Decay: 3. (When there are three cards on this event, destroy it.) Plays in your core. Order - Place a card from hand on this event to reveal a number of cards from the top of an opponent's deck equal to the number of Gatherers you command. For each event and interrupt revealed this way, you may draw a card.

card.name: Ghost Stories
card.text: Plays in your core. When you play this event, name a non-dual dilemma. Your copies of that dilemma are Persistent. (When your personnel complete a mission, a Persistent dilemma's owner may discard a non-personnel card from hand to return that dilemma to his or her dilemma pile.)

card.name: Good Shepherd
card.text: Decay: 3. (When there are three cards on this event, destroy it.) Plays in your core. At the start of each of your turns, you may stop your {Voy} Commander to download a non-unique personnel or a {Voy} personnel who costs 1 or less and place them on this event. When this event is destroyed, place each personnel here aboard your {Voy} ship.

card.name: Hall of Warriors
card.text: Decay: 3. (When there are three cards on this event, destroy it.) To play this event, you must command three {kli} personnel. Plays in your core. When you win combat or an engagement, place the top card of your deck on this event. Each of your {kli} ships is attributes +1 for each card on this event.

card.name: Improvised Modifications
card.text: Decay: 3. (When there are three cards on this event, destroy it.) Plays in your core. Order - Place your {fed}{Maq} personnel on top of this event to make each of your {Maq} ships attributes +1 until the end of turn and each opponent chooses a personnel he or she commands to return to his or her owner's hand.

card.name: In a Mirror, Darkly
card.text: Lose 5 points to shuffle each personnel and ship you own in your discard pile into your deck and then draw cards until you have seven cards in hand. Remove this event and all the other cards in your discard pile from the game.

card.name: Military Assault Command Operations
card.text: Download a MACO. Destroy this event.

card.name: One Man Can Summon the Future
card.text: Plays in your core. When you play a personnel who has a cost of 4 or more, examine the top five cards of your deck and replace them in any order. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Quark's Advice
card.text: To play this event, you must command Ferenginar. Download a card and place it beneath your Ferenginar. Destroy this event.

card.name: Reclaim Terok Nor
card.text: Decay: 3. (When there are three cards on this event, destroy it.) Plays in your core. Each {car} personnel and {dom} personnel you own gains {TN}. At the start of each of your turns, place a card from hand on this event.

card.name: Standard Orbit
card.text: To play this event, you must command two missions worth 40 or more points. Plays in your core. When an opponent is about to download a card, he or she can only download from the top ten cards of his or her deck. When an opponent discards a personnel from your hand or from the top of your deck, you may place him or her on the bottom of your deck instead.

card.name: Straight and Steady
card.text: Decay: 5. (When there are five cards on this event, destroy it.) Plays in your core. When your personnel aboard a {sf} ship uses a skill to complete a mission worth 40 or more points, you may place a card from hand on this event. Order - Destroy this event to download a non-interrupt card that has a cost equal to the number of cards on this event.

card.name: The New Occupation
card.text: Decay: 5. (When there are five cards on this event, destroy it.) Plays in your core. While your {car} personnel or {dom} personnel is attempting a mission aboard your {TN} ship, you may place your Dissident on this event to make that personnel attributes +1 until the end of that mission attempt.

card.name: The Reckoning
card.text: Decay: 5. (When there are five cards on this event, destroy it.) Pah-wraith. Prophet. Plays in your core. While your {baj} personnel is facing a dilemma, you may place a Prophet card or a Pah-wraith card from your hand on this event to make that personnel attributes +1 until the end of this turn.

card.name: U.S.S. Enterprise-J
card.text: Plays in your core. Each of your personnel at a mission that is worth 40 or more points is attributes +1.

card.name: Vacation from the Continuum
card.text: Q. To play this event, you must command a Q event. Plays in your core. When you have drawn dilemmas, you may destroy your other Q event to draw five extra dilemmas.

card.name: Walk the Line
card.text: Decay: 3. (When there are three cards on this event, destroy it.) Plays in your core. When your {baj}{DS9} personnel is about to be stopped, you may place your {fed}{DS9} personnel on this event to prevent that. When your {fed}{DS9} personnel is about to be stopped, you may place your {baj}{DS9} personnel on this event to prevent that.

card.name: Advanced Tactical Training
card.text: When your {fed}{Maq} personnel is facing a dilemma, destroy one of your events to add that event's cost to that personnel's attributes until the end of this mission attempt.

card.name: Covenant
card.text: Pah-wraith. When your {baj} Treachery personnel is facing a dilemma, remove a {baj} personnel in your discard pile from the game to make that Treachery personnel gain all skills and attributes on that {baj} personnel removed from the game until the end of this turn.

card.name: Dear Friends
card.text: When a {DS9} personnel you command is about to be killed by a dilemma that costs 3 or more, discard an {E} personnel from hand to prevent that.

card.name: Rule of Acquisition #33
card.text: Rule. When your {fer} personnel is facing a dilemma, say It never hurts to suck up to the boss to choose one - make that personnel attributes +2 until the end of the turn; or replace all levels of any one skill in that dilemma's requirements with 3 Acquisition.

card.name: Silent Strike
card.text: To play this interrupt, you must command a staffed ship that has been on Engage Cloak since the start of your turn. Order - Take your staffed ship off Engage Cloak to place it at a non-headquarters mission where an opponent's ship is at and begin an engagement involving your personnel aboard that ship. If you win, randomly kill two opponent's personnel involved.

card.name: Aid Lost Colony
card.text: Biology, Diplomacy, Leadership and Integrity>39 This mission is worth 10 fewer points for each other mission you command that does not require Biology, Diplomacy, or Leadership.

card.name: Commandeer Prototype
card.text: Intelligence, Officer, Treachery, and Cunning>33 or Leadership, 2 Officer, and Cunning>35 When you complete this mission, you may download a ship and place it at this mission (That ship is stopped). Name an affiliation. The downloaded ship becomes the named affiliation.

card.name: Eliminate Sphere Network
card.text: Astrometrics, Leadership, Navigation, Security, and Cunning>40 or Engineer, 2 Leadership, and Strength>46 Region: Delphic Expanse.

card.name: Elude Federation Forces
card.text: 2 Astrometrics, 2 Navigation, and Strength>32 or Engineer, 2 Programming, Treachery, and Cunning>32 Region: Demilitarized Zone. When you complete this mission, if you command four {Maq} personnel at this mission, score 10 points.

card.name: Expand Business Opportunities
card.text: Acquisition, Anthropology, and (Diplomacy and Cunning>30 or Treachery and Strength>30) When you end a mission attempt at this mission, your opponent to your left may place the top two cards of his or her dilemma pile under this mission to score 5 points.

card.name: Find Lifeless World
card.text: 2 Biology, 2 Exobiology, and Cunning>33 You may attempt and complete this mission using your {sf} personnel with these requirements: Honor, Leadership, 2 Security and Strength>35. Order - Discard six cards from hand to draw five cards.

card.name: Follow Homing Beacon
card.text: Engineer, Programming, Transporters, (Honor or Treachery), 2 Androids and Cunning>35 Each Unscientific Method revealed here is cost -2.

card.name: Navigate Xindi Corridor
card.text: Astrometrics, Engineer, Science, a {Fut} personnel and Cunning>31 Nebula. Region: Delphic Expanse. When you move to your Region: Delphic Expanse mission, if this mission is completed, that mission is span -1.

card.name: Patrol Neutral Zone
card.text: Astrometrics, 2 Leadership, 2 Security, and Cunning>34 Region: Neutral Zone. When you complete this mission, score 5 points for each Region: Neutral Zone mission you command that does not have an opponent's ship at it.

card.name: Purchase Moon
card.text: 2 Acquisition, Astrometrics, Geology, and Cunning>39 When you complete this mission, if your personnel completing it have 4 Acquisition, you may place a card from hand beneath your Ferenginar.

card.name: Restore Errant Moon
card.text: 3 Astrometrics, Engineer, and Cunning>35 When you begin a mission attempt at this mission, each player may search his or her dilemma pile and set aside a Consume dilemma, shuffle his or her dilemma pile, and then place that dilemma on top of his or her dilemma pile.

card.name: Risa Shore Leave
card.text: Anthropology, and (Archaeology, Science, Treachery, and Cunning>36 or Diplomacy, Exobiology, Officer, and Integrity>32) When you complete this mission, score 5 points for each different species of personnel who uses his or her skills to complete this mission.

card.name: Kira Nerys (First Officer)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Honor {SD}Officer {SD}Security Order - If you command two missions worth 40 or more points, discard four cards from hand to take a {baj} personnel from your discard pile and place it on your headquarters mission.

card.name: Leeta (Union Member)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Honor {SD}Leadership Dabo Girl. When this personnel is randomly selected by a dilemma, you may take the top card of the opponent on your left's dilemma pile and place it beneath your mission that is worth 40 or more points.

card.name: Winn Adami (Religious Opportunist)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Law {SD}Leadership {SD}Treachery Vedek. Order - Remove an event in your discard pile from the game to take a Consume dilemma or Persistent dilemma you own from beneath an opponent's completed mission and return it to your dilemma pile.

card.name: Borg Queen (Obsessed)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Exobiology {SD}2 Leadership {SD}Science {SD}2 Treachery When you play this personnel, if you have completed a mission requiring Exobiology or Science, she is cost -4. This personnel is the corresponding Commander of your {bor} ship that she is aboard.

card.name: Data (Tempted by Flesh)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}2 Engineer {SD}Exobiology {SD}2 Programming {SD}Science {SD}Treachery At the start of each of your turns, you may return this personnel to your hand. If you do not, remove this personnel from the game.

card.name: Crell Moset (Notorious Exobiologist)
card.text: {SD}2 Exobiology {SD}2 Medical {SD}Science {SD}2 Treachery When your {car} personnel present is about to be killed or stopped by a dilemma that costs 3 or more, you may discard a non-{car} personnel from hand to prevent that.

card.name: Silaran Prin (Between Darkness and Light)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Engineer {SD}Programming {SD}2 Treachery Assassin. Order - Name a personnel. When an opponent plays that personnel, you may place this personnel in his or her owner's discard pile to kill that personnel. This effect lasts until this order is executed again.

card.name: Eris (Duplicitous Vorta)
card.text: {SD}Biology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Medical {SD}Science {SD}Treachery When you reveal a Persistent dilemma from your dilemma stack, it is cost -1. When you begin combat involving this personnel, randomly select an opponent's personnel present to be excluded from that combat.

card.name: Founder Leader (Single-Minded)
card.text: {SD}Law {SD}2 Leadership {SD}Science {SD}2 Treachery Founder. Shape-shifter. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may discard a Morph card from hand to exchange a Founder in your hand with a Founder present.

card.name: Odo (The Great Link's Savior)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Exobiology {SD}Honor {SD}Law {SD}Leadership {SD}Programming {SD}2 Security Shape-shifter. When this personnel is about to be killed or stopped by a dilemma, you may have each opponent score 5 points to prevent that.

card.name: Talak'talan (Keen Third)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Exobiology {SD}2 Security {SD}Transporters While this personnel is attempting a mission worth 40 or more points, if he is present with a Founder and a Vorta, he is attributes +2.

card.name: Benjamin Finney (Bitter Records Officer)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Engineer {SD}Programming {SD}Treachery You may play this personnel at cost +2 to name a skill. Each player reveals his or her hand and places each revealed personnel with that skill on top of his or her owner's deck.

card.name: Benjamin Sisko (Bold Captain)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Engineer {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer While at a mission worth 40 or more points, this personnel cannot be stopped by dilemmas.

card.name: Beverly Crusher (Captain Picard)
card.text: {SD}Exobiology {SD}Honor {SD}Leadership {SD}Medical {SD}Officer Commander: U.S.S. Pasteur. While this personnel is attempting a mission worth 40 or more points, she is attributes +1 and gains Medical.

card.name: Clark Terrell (Reliant Captain)
card.text: {SD}Geology {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer {SD}Transporters Commander: U.S.S. Reliant. You may play this personnel aboard your U.S.S. Reliant. While you command a {na} ship, this personnel becomes {na}.

card.name: Data (Lucasian Chair)
card.text: {SD}2 Astrometrics {SD}Engineer {SD}Exobiology {SD}Physics {SD}Programming {SD}2 Science When you play this personnel, if you have completed a mission requiring Diplomacy or Leadership, he is cost -4.

card.name: Ezri Dax (Resourceful Counselor)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Geology Host. If you command Jadzia Dax, place this personnel in her owner's discard pile. Your {DS9} personnel and {E} personnel present cannot be killed by dilemmas that cost 3 or more.

card.name: Geordi La Forge (Retired Engineer)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Biology {SD}Engineer {SD}Honor {SD}Physics While this personnel is facing a Damage dilemma, you may lose 5 points to prevent and overcome that dilemma.

card.name: Katherine Pulaski (Chief Medical Officer)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Biology {SD}Exobiology {SD}Honor {SD}2 Medical When any number of your personnel present are about to be killed by a dilemma, you may shuffle each of those personnel into your deck instead.

card.name: Mot (The Barber)
card.text: {SD}Honor When your six personnel present attempt a mission, subtract one from the number of dilemmas your opponent may draw and one from the total cost he or she may spend on dilemmas.

card.name: Sarek (Logical Being)
card.text: {SD}2 Diplomacy {SD}Honor {SD}Law When you play this personnel, each player takes a Consume or Persistent dilemma he or she owns from beneath a mission and returns it to his or her dilemma pile.

card.name: Sarek (Vulcan Delegate)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Diplomacy {SD}2 Honor {SD}Science You may play this personnel at cost +1 to draw a card for each mission you command that is worth 40 or more points.

card.name: Sirna Kolrami (Famed Strategist)
card.text: {SD}Security While facing a dilemma, a personnel present may lose all of his or her skills until the end of that dilemma. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: The Doctor (Emergency Command Hologram)
card.text: {SD}Leadership {SD}Navigation {SD}2 Officer {SD}Programming {SD}2 Security Commander: U.S.S. Voyager. When you play this personnel, choose one - remove a Damage card from one of your ships, or download a Maneuver.

card.name: Leosa (Grifter)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Programming {SD}Treachery Dabo Girl. Thief. Order - Stop this personnel and choose an opponent to make that opponent choose a Hologram he or she commands and return him or her to his or her owner's hand.

card.name: Nog (Little Green Man)
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Engineer {SD}Honor {SD}Physics While this personnel is present with a {Pa} personnel, he cannot be stopped or killed by a dilemma that costs 3 or more.

card.name: Rom (Little Green Man)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Navigation {SD}Programming {SD}Science While this personnel is present with a {Pa} personnel, if he is attempting a mission worth 40 or more points, he is attributes +2 and gains one of every skill he already has.

card.name: Chang (Gorkon's Chief of Staff)
card.text: {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer {SD}2 Security {SD}2 Treachery Commander: I.K.S. Kla'Diyus. General. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may have him lose 2 Treachery to make him gain Diplomacy and Law until the end of this turn.

card.name: Gorkon (Visionary Chancellor)
card.text: {SD}2 Diplomacy {SD}2 Honor {SD}Law {SD}2 Leadership Chancellor. Commander: Kronos One. When you play this personnel, if you have completed a mission requiring Diplomacy or Leadership, he is cost -4.

card.name: Gowron (Celebrated Leader)
card.text: {SD}Honor {SD}Law {SD}2 Leadership Chancellor. When you play this personnel, if you command three events, he is cost -1. Order - Stop eight of your Honor Klingons to score 5 points.

card.name: Worf (Governor of H'atoria)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}2 Honor {SD}Leadership {SD}Security You may play this personnel at cost +2 aboard your {TNG} ship. When your Honor personnel present is about to be killed or stopped by a dilemma that costs 3 or more, you may discard an event from hand to prevent that.

card.name: D'Nesh (Manipulative Gift)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Engineer {SD}Programming {SD}Treachery Thief. While a personnel present is facing a dilemma, you may destroy your event to make that personnel attributes +1 until the end of the turn.

card.name: Harrad-Sar (Slave of the Situation)
card.text: {SD}Navigation {SD}Officer Commander: Devna-Lev. Smuggler. Thief. When you play this personnel, you may download up to three Thief personnel.

card.name: Hugh (Rogue Borg)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Engineer {SD}Exobiology {SD}Honor {SD}Leadership {SD}Programming Dissident. While this personnel is facing a dilemma, you may destroy your equipment present to add its cost to this personnel's attributes until the end of the turn.

card.name: Kasidy Yates (Conflicted Captain)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Leadership {SD}Navigation {SD}Transporters Commander: Xhosa. Smuggler. While present with four {Maq} personnel, each {Maq} personnel present is Strength +2.

card.name: Maras
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Exobiology {SD}Security {SD}Treachery Thief. While a personnel present is about to be killed by a dilemma that costs 3 or more, you may destroy your event to prevent that.

card.name: Navaar (Experienced Gift)
card.text: {SD}Acquisition {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Exobiology {SD}2 Leadership {SD}2 Treachery Thief. While a personnel present is facing a dilemma, you may destroy your event to have that personnel gain a skill of your choice until the end of the turn.

card.name: Neras (Slave Girl)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology When you play this personnel, you may draw two cards.

card.name: Persis (Loyal Daughter)
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Engineer {SD}Programming Genetically Enhanced.

card.name: Soval (Vulcan Ambassador)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}2 Diplomacy {SD}Honor {SD}Law {SD}Leadership {SD}Science While present with two {sf} personnel or two Vulcans, this personnel cannot be stopped or killed by dilemmas that cost 3 or more.

card.name: Tallera (Covert Isolationist)
card.text: {SD}Leadership {SD}Programming {SD}Science {SD}Security {SD}Treachery Smuggler. Thief. When you complete this mission, if it is worth 40 or more points, you may score 5 points.

card.name: Tuvix (Symbiogenesis)
card.text: {SD}Anthropology {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Exobiology {SD}Honor {SD}Law {SD}Navigation {SD}Security To play this personnel, remove two of your personnel at this mission from the game. You cannot play personnel with the same title as those personnel.

card.name: Nevala
card.text: {SD}Astrometrics {SD}Navigation {SD}Officer {SD}Programming While aboard a ship that has four or more staffing icons, this personnel is attributes +1.

card.name: Nanclus (Co-Conspirator)
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Law {SD}Treachery Order - Choose an opponent to reveal his or her hand. For each personnel revealed, this personnel is Cunning +1 and Strength +1 (if a {fed} personnel is revealed this way he may gain a skill of your choice as well) until the end of this turn. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Sela (Cunning Strategist)
card.text: {SD}Intelligence {SD}Leadership {SD}Officer {SD}Security {SD}2 Treachery While this personnel is facing a dilemma, if this mission is worth 40 or more points, you may meet that dilemma's Integrity or Strength requirements using Cunning instead.

card.name: D'Vela
card.text: {SD}Diplomacy {SD}Engineer {SD}Medical {SD}Navigation While a personnel present is facing a dilemma, if you have no cards in your hand, you may destroy your event to have that personnel gain a skill of your choice until the end of that dilemma.

card.name: Kelby (Industrious Engineer)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Programming {SD}Science {SD}Transporters When this personnel is about to be killed by a dilemma that costs 3 or more, if you have no cards in your hand, you may stop this personnel instead.

card.name: Stewart Rivers (Patriotic Engineer)
card.text: {SD}Engineer {SD}Geology {SD}Physics {SD}Programming Order - Discard a Decay event from hand to download an non-Decay event or interrupt. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Borg Queen's Vessel (Borg Flagship)
card.text: Order - Examine a number of cards from the top of your deck equal to the number of Persistent dilemmas you own beneath an opponent's missions. Set any number of those cards aside face down. Shuffle the remaining cards into your deck and place those cards on top of your deck in any order. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: I.K.S. Qel'Poh (H.M.S. Bounty)
card.text: Cloaking Device. While you command two missions that are worth 40 points or more, this ship is Range +2. While a personnel you command aboard this ship is facing a dilemma, you may discard a {Pa} personnel from hand to make that personnel attributes +1 until the end of that dilemma.

card.name: U.S.S. Pasteur (Medical Ship)
card.text: While your {fed} Medical personnel is aboard this ship, it is Range +5. While your {Fut} personnel aboard is attempting a space mission, you may destroy your Decay event to make that personnel gain a skill required by that mission until the end of this turn.

card.name: U.S.S. Prometheus (Experimental Prototype)
card.text: To play this ship, you must discard a personnel who costs 4 or more from hand. When you win an engagement involving this ship, you may discard a Decay event from hand to download a Damage card and place it on an opponent's ship at this mission.

card.name: U.S.S. Reliant (Searching for Lifeless Planets)
card.text: While you command a {TOS} personnel, you may play this ship at your Earth. When you complete this mission, you may destroy an event. (If that event is your event, you may download an event with a cost of 4 or more.)

card.name: I.K.S. Kla'Diyus (Prototype)
card.text: Cloaking Device. When you take this ship off of Engage Cloak, it is Weapons +3 until the end of the turn and you may begin an engagement involving your personnel aboard. If you win, name a personnel. Each opponent's copy of that personnel involved in that engagement is killed.

card.name: I.K.S. Qel'Poh (Clandestine Vessel)
card.text: Cloaking Device. While you command two missions that are worth 40 points or more, this ship is Range +2. While you have a captive, this ship is attributes +2.

card.name: Kronos One
card.text: Cloaking Device. Order - If your corresponding Commander is aboard this ship, search your dilemma pile and remove a Persistent dilemma from the game to make this ship attributes +2 until the end of the turn. Then shuffle and replace your dilemma pile. You may do this only once each turn.

card.name: Devna-Lev (Harrad-Sar's Barge)
card.text: While three of your {na} personnel are aboard this ship, it is Range +2 and when you reveal a Persistent dilemma from your dilemma stack, it is cost -1.

card.name: U.S.S. Reliant (Part of One Big Happy Fleet)
card.text: Order - Discard a {na} personnel from hand to make this ship attributes +2 until the end of this turn.

card.name: Scimitar (Built for Only One Purpose)
card.text: Cloaking Device. When you take this ship off of Engage Cloak, you may begin an engagement involving your personnel aboard this ship. If you win, name a personnel. Each opponent's copy of that personnel involved in that engagement is killed. Then unstop this ship and all personnel aboard this ship. You cannot begin any other engagements this turn. Also, this ship is Range +9 until the end of this turn.

card.name: U.S.S. Prometheus (Stolen Prototype)
card.text: To play this ship, you must discard a personnel who costs 4 or more from hand. When you win an engagement involving this ship, you may discard a personnel who has a cost of 4 or more from hand to download a Damage card and place it on an opponent's ship at this mission.
